data.text: To utter a deep guttural sound, as a hog does.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: To utter a sound similar to a grunt, as in disgust.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: To utter or express with a deep guttural sound.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Any of various chiefly tropical marine fishes of the family Haemulidae that produce a grunting sound by rubbing together their pharyngeal teeth.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: An infantryman in the US military, especially in the Vietnam War.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: One who performs routine or mundane tasks.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A dessert made by stewing fruit topped with pieces of biscuit dough, which steam as the fruit cooks.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: To make a guttural noise, as a hog; also, to utter short or broken groans, as from eagerness or over-exertion.
A deep guttural sound, as that made by a hog.
